quest.name: Lies, Damn Lies, and Pirates
journal: Alisaie is contemplating the logistics of a journey to the Far East.
objectives: Speak with Alphinaud in Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: STORMOFFICER
dialogue.text: How in Llymlaen's name did they find the Reach? I thought their glamours were impenetrable.

dialogue.name: SERPENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: I have called upon Stillglade Fane to send every available conjurer, no matter how inexperienced, to help with the wounded. I pray it will be enough.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: That which is beyond one alone may yet be within reach of the many.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: If there is truth in the rumors, this is not the first time Zenos has “spared” his foes. They say he abides by an unusual code, and takes pleasure in the fight. Whatever his reasons, we must use this time to our advantage.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: We've got a long road ahead of us...but it all begins with the first step.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: We'll stay in the Reach and rebuild. We'll reinforce our defenses. And if they come again, we'll be ready.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: I wish you well on your journey, my friend. Let us pray that when we meet again, our fortunes will be much changed.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I can't deny a part of me wants to stay and fight... But I know I'd be more use to you and the others.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: You've said your piece, yes? Now would you please return to bed? You'll never recover if you carry on like this!

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> Ye gods, the pain... It seemed like a good idea at the time...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: "Where men go as one, there is life. And where there is life, there is cause to hope.“ Our grandfather believed that, and so do I...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But before we can forge ties with our friends in the Far East, we must first find a way to reach them. Othard is not exactly over the river and through the woods.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I am one step ahead of you, dear sister─or rather, Tataru is. But before we discuss that, there is another issue I wish to address.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Much as I would like it if we could all make this journey together, someone will need to remain to serve as liaison to the Alliance and the Resistance during this critical period. Moreover, as Y'shtola cannot be left unattended...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: ...Then I should obviously remain? Very well. Issue addressed.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: You know, Alphinaud, it would have been quicker just to ask─and markedly less patronizing.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Y-Yes, I suppose, uh... Ahem. Would you be willing to look after Y'shtola and provide support to Arenvald and the others?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text:
Yes, Alphinaud. I would.
You see? That wasn't so hard, was it? Enjoy your trip, and don't you dare return with a gift!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text:
Oh, I would not dream of it...
Right, then. Sister, Forename, Lyse─gather your things. We are for Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Vylbrand was always Y'shtola's domain. I haven't spent much time here, to be honest...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I spoke with Urianger and Thancred along the way. To say they were surprised by our stratagem would be something of an understatement, but they did not dispute its logic.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Tataru should be here any moment with our ship's captain.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: So we're going by sea after all. Is Merlwyb lending us our pick of the Crimson Fleet?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Not...exactly. You are right, in as much as we will be traveling by sea. Regrettably, it is simply not feasible for an airship to travel such a distance without impossibly large fuel reserves, to say nothing of the inevitability of running afoul of the Empire's aerial defenses.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...But then it is equally infeasible to sail an Eorzean Alliance vessel halfway around the world without the Empire taking notice.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Which leaves us with only one other option... Ah, speak of the devil.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Sorry to keep you waiting! May I present to you Captain Carvallain of the Kraken's Arms!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The Kraken's Arms!? Don't tell me you made a deal with pirates!

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: Greetings and salutations, Scions. I take it from your comrade's tone that you no longer wish to proceed with our proposed arrangement?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Not at all, Captain. Pray forgive my sister her outburst─she has ever been one to speak her mind. I, on the other hand, am the very soul of discretion, as many well-respected personages would attest, from the offices of the Admiral, to the High Houses of Ishgard.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ah, but where was I? Oh, yes! The Scions of the Seventh Dawn do indeed still wish to employ your services. However, it is important that you are aware of certain extenuating circumstances...

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: ...And intent on securing passage to the Far East, you came to us, knowing us to be the proud purveyors of said region's finest spices.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...Which you steal from gods-fearing merchants out on the high seas.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: Whatever privateering the Kraken's Arms may or may not engage in is strictly within the limits of the law, as set forth by our indefatigable keeper of the peace. More to the point, we are pragmatists. I see considerable risk in aiding your cause, and negligible profit.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Well, I for one think the captain has a point. The five seas can be extremely treacherous, and many a poor, unfortunate soul has to come to grief out there on the waves.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Why, when we were in Ishgard, I heard the tragical tale of how the heir to House Durendaire vanished at sea!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Even now, nearly twenty years later, the poor count remains convinced that his son still lives, and would pay a sultan's ransom for news of his whereabouts...

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: Hahaha... Ahahahahaha!

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: Truly a tragedy for the ages, and a testament to the misfortunes that may befall us should we act without...due consideration. But so long as you are prepared to abide the capricious whims of fate, I am willing to oblige you this once.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: That said, in light of the recent rebellion, I trust you understand that I cannot deliver you to Doma itself. I can take you only as far as Kugane, in Hingashi.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: We will require time to procure sufficient provisions and make ready for departure. I humbly suggest you do the same.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I'm not sure what just happened. I could have sworn he was about to turn us away, but then he...changed his mind?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: (Blackmail, is it? This is a dangerous game the two of them are playing... What guarantee do we have that Carvallain won't just throw us overboard?)

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: The poor little boy had only seen fourteen summers when he left Ishgard. Can you imagine what it must have felt like─to finally be free to explore the world, unbeholden to all the stuffy traditions of the Holy See?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Such a shame that he never returned home. Without him, the Count de Durendaire must look elsewhere for a successor...and the good Lord Jannequinard is one step closer to being the next in line...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Suddenly, all those hours Tataru passed cavorting and capering at the Forgotten Knight seem rather better spent, do they not?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (That said, I had intended to press the point more obliquely... And there was something disconcerting about the pleasure Tataru took in making Captain Carvallain squirm...)
